Reviews.Title: “Last minute visit as BA let us down”
Reviews.Author: traveller50london
Reviews.Content: We found a welcoming haven here when we got seriously delayed in Istanbul. Hotel staff did everything they could to look after us. Interesting boutique hotel close to Hagia Sophia. Good food and breakfast with a lovely roof terrace

Reviews.Title: “Usual high standard”
Reviews.Author: Adrian186338
Reviews.Content: Have been several times to the hotel and the service has always been great.It is a small cosy hotel in a fantastic location with lots of history. I wouldnt go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_in_PDX
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Eresin Crown in the past 9 months. I continue to return due to the location and personal service. The staff is very accommodating and available to assist with even the smallest requests. I agree with other travelers, this hotel does not offer many rooms with a view; however, the view from the terrace during the summer months is perfect. Sultanahmet is not a quiet area, which is part of the charm, so remember to bring ear plugs or request a room that is not overlooking the main street. Construction is a constant in the surrounding buildings, as well as trucks which bring early deliveries to nearby markets. Regardless, the room is comfortable, the bath tubs have jets, and breakfast is fresh and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service, great location”
Reviews.Author: mulber
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in probably the best part of Istambul. All the attractions very close (you can reach them walking). Don't miss Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, The cisterns, Dolmabace. People at the hotel very nice they try to give you all the tips to take the most from this beatiful city. Cisterns are somethig you don't have to miss. Also the Spice Market and Big Bazar is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Alluring by the surroundings of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BENTRYPAKEN
Reviews.Content: Eresin Crown hotel is definitely impress you for the first time visiting in Istanbul. In my personal attitude toward this marvelous place is just to say "excellent". With the sea view from your balcony is absolutely fascinating and when is the time for praying, there's a charming holy voice from the Blue Mosque nearby. The hotel is located in a hearty Sultanahmet area, can walk to have a breathtaking moment of a stunning beautiful Blue Mosque within three minutes, or to see the Hagia Sophia, the hippodrom and other important attractions. There are reasonable price to fine-dinning restaurant nearby. The overall service here is a five-stars. There are many things which impress me a lot, such as the souvenir in the guest room which they provide e.g. small bag, hotel book which describe the history and the typical mosaic that they found in the area of the hotel, and a tin of chocolate given when checking out, nicely done turn down service, and promptly service when order food. Finally, next time when i visit Istanbul, i'll absolutely consider the Eresin Crown as the first choice ^_____^

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes such a positive difference in everything in a way you cannot even find in top rated hotels/resorts.”
Reviews.Author: Zeki N
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay during Feb 2012 (first time was Feb 2009) for four nights. I am not sure if we could have asked any more. The staff does an excellent job for treating their guests with respect and go out of their way to assist you. They are sincere, prompt and very professional. If one were to spend any time at Sultanahmet, this is the hotel to stay for your comfort, excellent food, service and most important you will feel you never left home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - superb staff, gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osymoko
Reviews.Content: Title says it all - spent 4 days in Feb, nothing too much trouble, faultless, really enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Dktari
Reviews.Content: With the Blue Mosque just steps away, this hotel is a peaceful and wonderful place to stay in Istanbul. Very good breakfast. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Calm comfort in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: abager
Reviews.Content: This is an idea medium-sized hotel conveniently situated behind the Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque. Rooms and bathrooms are comfortable, food excellent, but what distinguishes this hotel is the level of service. I made a small complaint that breakfast closed too early (at 10 am) over the weekend, and on Sunday morning found that they had extended it to 11. In every way the staff were kind and solicitous.The hotel is built on the rubble of Roman and Byzantine Constantinople and the ground floor displays artifacts, and even part of a wall, from that period. Highly recommended and good value for money.Preserves the personal touch that many big-name brand hotels have lost.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Eresin Crown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle01ch
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a unique boutique hotel within walking distance of a lot of Istanbul's historical sights such as the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, and the Grand Bazaar, you'll find it right here. Even the Topkapi Palace is only a half-hour stroll away. The hotel is unique because I have yet to come across another hotel with its own museum, and the ancient artifacts and mosaics on the ground floor lend a certain charm to the reception and the hotel bar. Despite its central location, the hotel is surprisingly peaceful. The rooms, although not large, are very nice and elegantly furnished. Breakfast was a treat with so much food to sample. Unfortunately, the terrace restaurant overlooking the Bosporus was closed due to the cold weather. We found the staff to be welcoming, helpful, and attentive - not at all obtrusive. They attended to all our needs swiftly and even gave us Turkish sweets as a farewell present! I warmy recommend the Eresin Crown, a refreshing change from the larger, impersonal chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend this excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henrique77294
Reviews.Content: This exelent hotel has the best staff i have ever met, excelent location, near major sights of Istanbul. I felt myself at home during my stay. The hotel is also very charming, with an interesting museum. All the requests were imediately answered. A truly 5 star hotel, charming, best staff, excelent location, more than we could expect.

Reviews.Title: “Charming haven, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: PTS99
Reviews.Content: We sought a boutique hotel, close to the main tourist hub but peaceful. We found it. Just a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque, this might just be the best hotel in the old town. Despite its location, with coaches passing the front door, it is remarkably peaceful. Unlike business or tourist hotels in most major cities, the Ersina seems almost shy; staff are friendly and helpful, but not overbearing or pushy - a welcome relief. The 5th floor terrace restaurant, overlooking the Bosphorous, is small but delightful. Mind you, it can be chilly at night. Cuisine is wholesome without being elaborate. Our room was elegant and comfortable, but a little cramped and TV performance was erratic. Overall, heartily recommnded for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “An EXCELLENT little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fatmahal
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best staff I've ever come across. They're incredibly polite but friendly and always willing to help: from the reception staff to the bellhops and the waiters (during breakfast). We arrived really early in the morning and our room was made available before 9 am! We were also given a late check out the day we were leaving. Although we were looking forward to exploring Istanbul and having breakfast at small cafÃ©s, the Eresin Crown offered such a wholesome breakfast that we ended up eating at our hotel every morning. The location is great, we were withing walking distance to all the monuments and we often walked over to the tram station on Sultanahmet if we wanted to leave the area. The area is very quiet and feels safe until around 10:30 or 11 pm. It's probably best to be in a small group if you're out after that time.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is great.”
Reviews.Author: elena4vie
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful always coming to your room immediately to assist with anything or bring you anything you may need. The hotel is not too big, so it has a quaint feel. The rooms are wonderful, comfortable, very clean and quiet. There is even a jacuzzi in the bathtub. The breakfast buffet is amazing. This hotel pays attention to little details such as leaving you Turkish Delights in your room that are delicious, having a tray of dates and apricots in the lobby, and stopping by the room in the afternoon for free snacks and drinks. The roof has a fantastic view of the sea and town. The hotel is tucked away but not far from the main Sultanhamet area, so it is quiet yet only a five minute walk from anything you would want to see and do. It is also very close to the sea if you like to jog or walk in solitude, and there are some restaurants and shops just outside the hotel. It was just great!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: mer16
Reviews.Content: If you are not just looking for pleasure but also some unique features I would highly recommend Eresin Crown Hotel. The hotel itself is one with a rich historical facts and findings that you will find in the lobby and dining area itself. The location is absolutely great because it is just walking distance to tourist attractions like the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque, Hagria Sophia ,Grand Bazaar and museums. Taxi ride will not be a problem because just some meters away there is a taxi stand that are all reliable. You can save money on a half day tour by yourself. Also shopping will be easy because it is also near to the Grand Bazaar, Arasta Bazaar and there are lots of small souvenir shops around the area. If you are looking for genuine staffs like carpets, Iznik vases and ceramics just ask the staff and they will gladly tell you where to go.The staff is so accommodating and hospitable. They are all highly professionals not only in hotel matters but also anything regarding Istanbul. The breakfast buffet is just great from a variety to choices. Their terrace restaurant will already give you the idea of what to see in Istanbul. There is free internet service at the lobby with floral scent where you can do some personal business while having coffee and cookies for a very low price. Our room is very comforting with windows overlooking the sea. Very clean and well kept daily. It might not be as big as other hotels on the outside but I can say with a very big smile that staying here is a huge experience. Thanks to all the staff of the Eresin Crown, you made our vacation a wonderful experience !

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: delilah62
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely satisfied with our Eresin Crowne Hotel right by Sultenahmet Square in Istanbul,Turkey. It was warm and inviting and beautifully appointed with antiquities set around the lobby and dining room area of pieces that were discovered upon the building of the hotel. They had labels explaining the find and it's importance. The rooms are not the Intercontinental, but they were large and you could have a queen or double beds. We had a sitting area and we looked out on the Blue Mosque every morning! The terrace at the top gave a raptuous view of the busy Bosphorous River and it was a 7 minute walk up our cobblestone street to the square where you have the Blue Mosque,the Hagia Sophia,the Hippodrome, and a large park area for great people watching! It was a fair price: $170 euros a night. We stayed 3 nights and it included a buffet breakfast in a lovely setting. There was free internet in the lobby which was no problem. Comfortable couch areas with sprays of flowers around you while you type! The staff was delightful. Some one was always at the desk to help you as you came through the lovely front entrance. We would definitely stay at the Eresin again. They even gave us a box breakfast to take to the airport when we left! We had ended a long 22 day trip from Venice to Istanbul and a flight over to Capadocia to see the fairy chimneys and cave dwellings and this was just the right hotel for us: small,warm and inviting, and comfortable! Make sure it is the Eresin by Sultanahmet Square.....

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on this trip”
Reviews.Author: DemiTass
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel is well trained to offer the guests a stay worth talking about for years to come. We switched hotels to this one when we were not satisfied with the original booking. The contrast between the two hotels is phenomenal. The appointments are absolutely beautiful. The entire staff knows the brief history of the artifacts found on the site as the hotel was being built. The breakfast was wonderful, serving both Turkish and American styles. We were never approached in the lobby to join a tour, which happened in the previous hotel. In fact, the staff has a list of tour guides and are determined to make sure the guest gets the tour they want with the guide they pair up with. This is a great, no hassle concept. This hotel made our stay in Sultanahmet a wonderful memory.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel with INCREDIBLE staff.”
Reviews.Author: P H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. The location can't be beat as it is in walking distance to so many historic sites. The hotel and staff was fantastic helping us find restaurants, guides etc. The breakfast was grand with a lovely assortment of foods. Everyone was so proud of the Hotel, and city. Loved the use of artifacts in the hotel as it gave you a feel of the culture in the city. We had an unrelated medical emergency at the end of our trip and the staff helped to provide us with every resource and ensure that the medical care my wife needed was at the highest level possible. We highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Higher end hotel, walk to major sites”
Reviews.Author: 75205Traveler
Reviews.Content: Did major research & found this to be one of few higher-end options within walking distance to major sites. Pleasantly surprised by huge suite with hardwood floors, traditional "English" decor. Teens in adjoining double. Baths modernized & sleek. LOVED hearing the calls to worship - added to ambience & didn't disrupt sleep. Pleasant breakfast buffet on rooftop. Quiet & discreet. Located on non-descript street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with a well trained staff. AND its a quick one block walk down to the Sea of Marmara, which is a lovely walk. AND right up the street is a wonderful little souk that's much less frantic than the Grand Bazaar. AND they have a marvelous rooftop restaurant. This Hotel is a gem--a real find. Go for the deluxe room; little quieter, nicer linens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lukewin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and enjoyed it immensely! Our room was very well appointed and service was outstanding. Very friendly and efficient staff both in the restaurant and the reception. The location is perfect, only 5- 10 minutes walk to major attractions. Having breakfast at the roof-top restaurant was a wonderful experience to start your day. The view of the Bosphorus Strait is spectacular and, if we didn't have a long list of places to visit, we would be ordering a bottle of champagne every morning. It's interesting that another couple recommended visiting Antonio in the Bar Hippodrome across the street. Indeed, he is a very nice and friendly bloke and we enjoyed having some meals there. Luke and Elizabeth - Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: nesecag
Reviews.Content: its a beautiyfull ciÅŸty that everyone should see and a very confortable hotel with excellant wieve of old istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: KipWilson
Reviews.Content: In the heart of old Istanbul close to the Aga Sohpie and Topkapi Palace; excellent roof top dinning overlooking the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kakiiian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights the end of August. We loved the hotel - friendly and helpful staff, the rooms were very lovely with slippers and robes. The rooftop terrace was a joy! What a way to start your day with breakfast overlooking the sea. The location was ideal as well, close to all the sights, but yet on a quaint street. The only slightly negative comment is the bathroom soap/shampoo and conditioner - i think for a hotel of this high caliber - they could upgrade these. But, I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Staff took very good care of us”
Reviews.Author: dcfleck
Reviews.Content: There for 3 days in mid-August 2011. Room was nicely appointed and well-maintained. My wife felt a little under the weather, and the staff was very helpful in looking after us while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Worth Mentioning”
Reviews.Author: Win M
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but compliments about this hotel. Everyone employed here speaks wonderful English and works very hard at making the guest stay a most positive experience. The balcony restaurant is so nice for breakfast as well as dinner. The artifacts that are displayed in the lobby and the conference rooms are beautiful! This is a perfect place to call "home" while in Istanbul on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and had some problems but a great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: risal
Reviews.Content: The Eresin Crown Hotel is in a great location close to the Sultan Ahmet Mosque and Aya Sofia, and it has a splendid breakfast buffet (and the staff will make you Turkish coffee on request if you don't like the wishywashy filter stuff). The evening meal I had (as part of a group) on the first night was pretty awful, though. The hotel has some interesting archaeology in the lobby, and a nice selection of books about Istanbul, Islamic art and architecture etc., to read while waiting in the lobby. But the room had its problems, not least the fact that it took for ever (5 mins or more) to get even lukewarm water for a shower - and for a hotel that aspires to green credentials, wasting that much water doesn't make sense. I had another room for one night where the hot water was OK. However, at the price, the plumbing should be flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and family friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: hcw427
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a total or 4 nights while in Istanbul. The rooms were beautiful and well appointed. Very clean! Each room has it's own air conditioning unit (a must in Istanbul in the summer) a lovely over sized jetted bath tub, robes and slippers, etc. The lobby is beautiful, with nuts and fresh fruit always available.There's free wifi in the lobby with a desk top computer for your use. There's also wifi in the room. Their terrace is lovely offering great views of the city and especially the Blue Mosque. Breakfast is served on the terrace under retractable awnings. The selection is extensive and delicious. Their location is perfect! We walked to all of the big sites; Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, The Grand Bazaar, Hippodrome, etc.. It is also within walking distance to their tram system. The staff is wonderful! At breakfast one morning towards the end of our trip, my 16 year old son became ill (fever, sore throat, nausea...it had nothing to do with breakfast!). At that point only the maitre de was aware that he was sick. Within minutes of returning to our room we got a call from the front desk offering to bring a Dr. to the hotel at no charge to us, as well as free room service so that he didn't need to leave the room to eat. They also gave us a deeply discounted price on a separate room for him. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay here when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- great location”
Reviews.Author: Henry_Shapiro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, seasoned independent travellers in our 60s, made a 3-1/2 week tour of western Turkey. We stayed at this hotel for five nights and spent four full days touring Istanbul. If you hate hotels overrun with tour groups, this hotel is for you -- it caters to independent travellers, businessmen, and small upscale tours (a small medical conference [with some touring thrown in] was there when we were, which made for some interesting conversations and didn't make the hotel feel crowded). Hotels in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul are older, boutique hotels, and even if renovated, tend to have small rooms -- we booked a room one level up from standard, figuring that that would give us a slightly larger room. Even so, it was small. But you don't book a hotel in Sultanahmet to get luxury, spas or swimming pools -- you choose one because it is a three minute walk to the Blue Mosque and then only a few minutes more to the Hagia Sophia and many other sights. And despite the cost (location in Istanbul is everything, and you pay for it), it was a great hotel for us and I recommend it unreservedly. The hotel actually has some museum quality Roman pieces recovered from the property on display in the elegantly furnished public rooms -- a nice touch. Their buffet breakfast, served on the fifth floor terrace in nice weather (great views), is excellent. The staff are helpful and gracious. We ate most nights in their restaurant -- most others seem to go out to nearby local places, get picked up by their hosts (businessmen) or are bused off to some evening activity (hamam experience, belly dancing show or Bosphorus tour) with included dinner. The food was good (though the restaurant can feel empty at times), especially if you selected Turkish dishes -- they do a better job on these than on "international cuisine". On nice evenings the terrace is open for drinks and dinner -- a great way to relax after a busy day or touring. Previous review: Kempinski, The Dome, Belek, Antalya Next review: Antique Boutique Hotel, Erdine

Reviews.Title: “Best service yet”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIntuitive
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here immensely. It's in a prime location and the service was over the top. Be aware, though, that this is more a 4 star hotel than a 5. I suggest asking for a room with a view, in a quiet location. I also needed a pad to soften the bed. Also, there is no free internet in the room, though the lobby is a lovely place to catch up on work and email. Be sure to enjoy the rooftop view. It's especially wonderful at sunset when six mosques call everyone to prayer. Very magical.

Reviews.Title: “good location, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: extremehard2please
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. rooms very clean and well equipped. spoke good English in reception and happy to help with general queries. laptop in reception with internet access. breakfast only let down (cooked breakfast, pretty poor), but good variety and happy to oblige with making eggs to your liking. location is great, walking distance to blue mosque and Aya Sofia. Tram station very close by. restaurants and bazaar also very close.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and start for the day”
Reviews.Author: sanderson_john
Reviews.Content: With a view from the window of the Blue Mosque, on a quiet street only a few steps from the Hippodrome, this is the perfect place for a short holiday. Breakfast was superb with a wide choice and an attentive staff. The archeological exhibits were tastefully arranged and provided the right mood for this city of great fascination. It was easy to drop off shopping bags and rest between excursions. The tram was nearby as was a great variety of restaurants at all price levels for an evening meal. Getting back to the airport was easily arranged with a shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: cmayer75
Reviews.Content: As all reviewers said; "the hotel is located in the heart of almost everything".. Could not think of a better location.. We were so impressed with the traditional welcome in the boutique museum - hard to say that it is a hotel lobby and all staff were ready to help with a smile.. We didn't need to go to an net cafÃ© because there was a laptop in the lobby with free internet.. The rooms were spacious enough with a jacuzzi bath to relax at the end of the day. Breakfast was really great, There was a wide selection of delicious food at breakfast and all seemed to be handpicked carefully.. And it worths every cent we paid for this luxury trip, we must make another trip to enjoy the terrace when it is warmer or we should re-schedule our way back to CA:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Stevecho
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Eresin Crown Hotel in Istanbul . Combined trip for Business and Wedding Anniversary Celebration . Excellent location in the old City , close to the main tourist sites . Levels of service throughout the Hotel were really very good . Reception staff , especially [Murat and Tekim ] were exemplary and offered a high level of customer care and assistance , nothing was too much trouble for them Highly Recommended .

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 star or 4 star for that matter... maybe a nice 3 star”
Reviews.Author: TheGooseDublin
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by this hotel... it is far from quality. I can only say one good thing about it, that was its location. Perfect walking distance to the Blue Mosque etc. HOWEVER, its so close, that you can hear the lovely singing from the Mosque at 4am every day, so dont count on getting sleep if you dont have ear plugs with you... We booked via booking.com. An exclusive room etc. On arrival, our room wasnt ready. After waiting 30 minutes we were given a normal double room. After much complaining and arguing, we were given a new room, which was only slightly bigger than the other room... total mess. Very small, hardly any room for 2 suitcases, so we felt like we were living in a factory after doing 2 days of shopping... bath is NOT a jacuzzi bath, but simply a bath that streams some water in it, so dont be fooled by that. The bed was TINY, and very uncomfortable, at least for us. The electricity. Oh dont get me started. All the plugs and lights are wired off one main switch in the rooms. So if you turn off all your lights, you cannot watch TV or charge your phones or laptop etc. while you are in bed. unreal. So be warned if you are a business traveler, or if like us, you like to watch a movie in bed after a long day shopping and wandering. As for the shower... well, it goes hot and cold all the time, either freezing you or burning you... its just not acceptable really. We travel away from home for some comforts that we dont have at home. By day 2 we were longing for our home! As for service, it sucks. Depending on who you ask, you will get a different answer, right down to directions around the city. Luckily we double checked each time before trusting anyones thoughts on a query! What else? well to be honest, I could go on... but I dont really want to waste too much of your time, as you can see, simply this hotel is sub standard and will never be a luxury, 4 or 5 star hotel in our books. One last gripe however, internet... you have to pay for it! CRAZY. For such an expensive hotel, you have to pay for that extra???? Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service to add to great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaiMirpuri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located walking distance from all the attractions in the old city like the blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, grand bazaar, cemberlitas hamam, etc. The rooms are nicely done and very comfortable. Each room has a jacuzzi in the bathroom. They give you wireless internet in the room for free (15 minutes though) and there is a laptop in the lobby that you can use for free as well. The breakfast every morning was excellent and was a perfect way to start a long day of sight-seeing. The staff was very helpful and courteous. I even noticed that they wouldn't hesitate to take breakfast up to a guest's room if asked. I was recommended a great kebab place in Sultanahmet by the front office staff and it turned out to be excellent. They helped with making reservations and overall were super. The roof terrace restaurant has an excellent view of the marmara sea and bosphorus as well. It was too cold when we went to try it but we went up to get a glimpse.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barryxxcullum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary.It may have been cold in Istanbul but this was forgotten by the warmth of our reception and the kindness and first class service of all the staff . Our room was extremely comfortable with a large ensuite bathroom. A wide selection of delicious food at breakfast meant that we were fully energised to tackle the sites! We had two dinners in the hotel ,both very good and for the second on our actual anniversary we were surprised with a chocolate cake. The hotel's location is ideal for exploring all of the well known sites in the Sutanahmet area

Reviews.Title: “brilliant service with a smile !”
Reviews.Author: vmaitin
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the friedliest set of people I have come across in 20 years of my travel to over 35 countries. Keep it up. I shall always use this hotel when I am in Istanbul.If only they had complimentary coaches to Taksim at least twice a day.Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ghsalzburg
Reviews.Content: We were a smaall group of 3 who went to Istanbul to celebrate our mother's birthday. Upon arrival we were seated and got turkish coffee served which was delicious! The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet offers a wide variety, the coffee is really good and the restaurant's ambiente stylish but still cheerful. We also had dinner at the hotel on our last evening and the food is delicious and the service again very professional and friendly. On our mother's birthday the management surprised her with a birthday cake with candles, which made a lovely surprise at the end of that day. The location is absolutely perfect for sight seeing - Sultanahmet Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi, the Underground cistern and the Grand Bazar are all within walking distance, a tram station 5 minutes away that takes one all the way to the Dolmabahce Palace - all in all - a dream location and hotel! When I go back, this will definitely be the hotel of my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and great Location”
Reviews.Author: vespo90
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back home after spending 3 nights at this fantastic hotel. The staff where more then helpful. They went out of there way on multiple occasions to assist us when ever we wanted help with directions and wanted advise. I couldn't ask for better service. Thank you so much to all the amazing staff. You really made my first time trip to Istanbul that much memorable. I also want to add how fantastic the location is with amazing views of the sea and city. It may be a low set hotel but it's situated on a hill so you really do get a birds eye view of the city and surroundings on the roof top terrace. I want to sincerely thank the staff at Eresin Crown Hotel for your amazing hospitality. The farewell chocolates that you give as a gift on check out was a very nice personal touch. I would recommend this property to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A quality hotel with excellent service in a location convenient to key sites”
Reviews.Author: LeoDundalk
Reviews.Content: I came upon the Eresin Crown Hotel quite by accident and what good fortune. The property is of a high standard and is unique in that it has very tastefully displayed archeological artifacts as part of its museum display. The accommodation both in the bedrooms and public areas was very clean and comfortable and the staff in the restaurant / bar and reception were friendly and very helpful. I would be very happy to stay at the Eresin Crown Hotel on a future visit to Istanbul a city that is so rich in culture and history and the hotels location is very central to many key sites.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevecho
Reviews.Content: The location is Great ... The service was excellent . Roof - top Restaurant sensational views of Istanbul . Breakfast also served on the roof , great variety offered . Highly recommended .....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gem of a hotel, Clean, exclusive and amazingly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Aasam
Reviews.Content: As you enter the hotel, you find that you are transformed from the hustle and bustle outside to a splendid and brilliant hotel where the staff is really welcoming. One of the first things the reception, inform you, is where you are situated on a map, and how you get back to the hotel, if you get lost. We stayed in a standard double bedroom, which was clean, and on arrival, there was a welcome toiletery pack that contained a full complement of items, including a razor, toothbrush, toothpaste, sewing kit, slippers, etc. Tea/Coffee making facilities were provided in the room, together with a complimentary bottle of water, EVERY DAY. Breakfast included poached and scrambled eggs, hot and cold meats,and if you asked you could also have an omelette (with cheese, onion, tomatoes, turkey ham), and fried eggs. All this was included in the bed and breakfast deal. One of the most important things was that the juices were carton fresh, and not the usual TANG that you would normally get. Additional tips: There is a computer that is connected to the internet and has a printer, and we found this very useful as we could check in on-line for our return flights, and also print our boarding cards, and this did not incur any charge. We asked if there was a laundry room, or if we could borrow an iron, and the manager at reception said that one of the staff members in the morning would iron our clothes (within reason) for us, without incurring a charge. To summarise, all I would like to say is that the ERESIN crown staff showed us exemplary professionalism, and also maintained an excellent code of conduct, and I am sure that this will be maintained. The hotel is very clean, and is located a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia, but be warned that the shortcuts are a steep climb.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly accomodation however very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: tripad411
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and good located, you can expect a very friendly staff to welcome you and to take care of all your requests. The rooms are quit small. Please ask a room at te back side as the once on the street are very noisy. Very close to all monuments however nothing to see in the evening. finaly i can recomd this Hotel. Very good service !!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel & location is perfect to explore Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: helen168
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beautifully appointed rooms within walking distance to the blue mosque, sancta sophia and all the other wonderful attractions this city offers. I was very disappointed in the buffet breakfast. I'd give it 2 stars. Also the roof-top area lacked atmosphere and it would have made things more enjoyable if breakfast were served there. We previously stayed at another quality hotel in Instanbul and their buffet meals and roof-top area are sensational. Also this is the first 5 star hotel during our 4 week trip that charged for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “a decent choice for the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanFoodie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The room was acceptable, the service was okay but not top notch, it is in a very good location to get to all of the sites in the Sultanahmet, okay breakfast (has room for improvement) and best of all it has a a very nice terrace with a great view of the Bosphorus which made a mediocre breakfast seem better. We paid the equivalent of about 140.00 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - it made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Kandinsky1616
Reviews.Content: This fabulous hotel lived up to and exceeded our already high expectations. The concept of hotel and museum worked beautifully. Our room was spacious and spotless with extra little touches that made us feel special. We loved everything from the roof terrace restaurant right down to the welcoming reception area.The staff were professional and friendly - nothing was too much trouble for them - we felt very safe in their hands. Excellent location in the old town, minutes from the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and a wonderful street bazaar that we visited again and again. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “There must be a lot worse places to stay - no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: nessie36
Reviews.Content: Must be agents in the UK misleading clients that this is a 5* hotel as our agent has it listed as a 4*. However, we had no real complaints - very central location so expect the street to be busy from an early hour ( as most of the streets in this area seem to be) with buses delivering tourists to the (very) nearby tourist sites . Room was 'basic' Turkish decor, good size bathroom, all clean and tidy but not the thickest of walls so you can hear some noise from neighbouring rooms/corridor. Good breakfast served on the terrace so who can complain with the view and all that fresh fruit on offer? Food at night a bit disappointing but hardly the worst anyone could have had on any holiday when eating out can be a bit of a lottery, and if you have had a busy day sightseeing, perfectly fine for an evening meal. All the staff that we encountered were always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel. Certainly not 5*....”
Reviews.Author: CDubUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of those very average hotels you find in so many cities and charges far too much for what it is. Whilst very well positioned in the heart of Sultanahmet, it's just a wee bit shabby and sticky round the edges with some corridors that smell of smoke (we had to ask to change our room...make sure you ask for a non-smoking floor, not just room). The previous week we had stayed at the A'jia for the same price and it was in a totally different league. The roof terrace has great views and the service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable oasis in the middle of busy, historic old town”
Reviews.Author: emememSFbayarea
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Eresin Crown. We stayed in a deluxe suite, which was appointed in a lovely manner, both eastern and western. We really appreciated the quiet -- barely heard any street noise (although we did wake up for the 5:00am call to prayers that you hear all over the city). And the location is just amazing! A very short walk to the main attractions of the area: blue mosque, hagia sopha, Tokapi palace, and not too far to the Grand Bazaar and the Bosphorus. The suite has a lot of room in it and the AC worked very well. The bathroom was large but had a typical European shower which for me means a flood all over the floor. Lovely towels and robes. The breakfasts were AMAZING. The view from the rooftop was FANTASTIC -- you can see the blue mosque, the golden horn, and other bodies of water -- and the food was really really good. The service was good; one of the desk managers was friendly, the other was not. But they found a terrific guide for us. The internet worked well in the lobby but they charge for use in the room. One travel tip: avoid the tram when crowded. We were packed in without the ability to move and got a wallet stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: iglockley
Reviews.Content: The management are excellent and very responsive. We checked in and expressed concerns about our room, regarding the a range of little attention-to-detail things that should represent 5 star (and the price we paid). The management were very swift and responsive and upgraded our room at no charge, which had none of the little problems the first one had. So management are terrific. I do hope they fix some of the minor faults in the first room though (a bit noisy, mould around bathroom fittings and ceiling, and 4 or 5 other minor things that didn't represent value for money at the time). Ian, Saudi Arabia

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: windspouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on business/pleasure. Well located hotel and very quiet in an otherwise noisy city. Rooms were fairly sized and very comfortable. Great roof top terrace with above average breakfast. The management went out of their way to return to me promptly, to the States, a cashmere sweater that I had left behind. Could not have asked for more. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE/COSY/QUIET WALKING DISTANCE FROM PEARLS OF ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: Adrian186338
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. The hotel is not like these American 5 star hotels it is medium size and the rooms are beautifully decorated and the staff are so helpful and friendly nothing is too much trouble. We will definitley be back soon hopefully !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Kennemerstrand
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erisin is a nice boutique hotel very well located arounf th corner of th eBlue Mosque. The staff is very friendly . If you consider staying in a romantique hotel in Istanbul The Erisin Crown hotel is a good place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, and a very comfortable base indeed”
Reviews.Author: Snappers_Inc
Reviews.Content: We hadn't originally booked this hotel, but (long story) had to flee from our original choice at c 8pm on our first night in Istanbul. The Eresin Crown was round the corner, and looked just what we needed - they welcomed us in, found us a room, and we were soon very happily settled there. The location is brilliant: mere steps away from the very tempting Arasta Bazaar, Blue Mosque, etc. If even that is too far, you can admire the views of the Blue Mosque from the roof terrace. Sultanahmet is a great place to base yourself. The rooms are well-equipped and spacious, and very comfortable (bathrooms are large, too). There's a restaurant (complete with Roman mosaic), but we only had breakfast there (as there are so many other options nearby) - good breakfast, though (local and western food on offer). Friendly and helpful staff throughout, free internet in Reception, and nice and warm, too (very important when it's started snowing outside...). A clean, warm, welcoming base to return to after a long and exciting day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly and supportive service at every level”
Reviews.Author: Parker040
Reviews.Content: We were marooned in Istanbul due to the Icelandic volcano, and could not have been better served and helped in every possible way. We would highly recommend this botel to anyone who wanted to be in this central area. Had an excellent guide for two of our days, which was well worthwhile. Her name is Nisla, and no doubt the hotel could give her email address to anyone who was interested.

Reviews.Title: “I was treated like a queen at Eresin Crown - I will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Screenflicka
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Eresin Crown hotel we were greeted by a knowledgeful receptionist. The staff ensured that our stay was throroughly enjoyable from extremely good breakfast service to having our small requests catered. Upon checking out we were given a book about the hotel as well as candies - a sign of a 5 * hotel indeed! We cannot but recommend Eresin Crown to others - not only because of its superb location next to the Blue Mosque and other important tourist sites - but more importantly because of its splendid decor, attentive staff and real 5* feeling through and through. The only negative thing we can say about the whole experience was the quality of the beds but then again we are used to sleeping on handmade beds that hotels never provide. Most importantly, we had no trouble sleeping on the slightly hard beds at Eresin Crown and what the hotel provided, exceeded all our expectations in many other ways.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect retreat”
Reviews.Author: Dawny
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break staying at the Eresin Crown -comfort, food staff and location all perfect. Such an amazing city and all main sights within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, historical Istanbul right in your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Mel
Reviews.Content: At nearly 6 months pregnant this was a last mini break with my husband before the baby arrives. We stayed for 3 nights and the hotel was just perfect, the staff were very helpful getting me extra pillows within moments of asking, the Manager was especially friendly and informative, he even took us to the terrace to take pictures of us before we left. FIrst night we were in a lovely room on the 4th floor, but it was way too hot overnight to sleep even though outside it was only 4degrees - it is the structure of that floor of the hotel. Sadly the french doors couldnt open up quite enough to let the air in properly due to being in the eaves/arches of the building, but the wonderful staff moved us to a room on the first floor where we were much more comfortable and the rooms are slightly bigger. So my top tip is stay away from the top floor unless the air con is working - which I presume is there in summer time. Aside from this small blip this hotel is wonderful, great staff, very useful helpful advice, very friendly and I would definitely stay there again and recommend my friends and family stay with the Eresin Crown. The location is perfect a few min walk on cobbled streets to the blue mosque and 10 mins to the very easy to use trams. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby the tram stop, plenty of choice. The Grand Bazaar is only a couple of stops away too - or probably a 20 min-half hour walk -so the location is great. I hope to go back to the Eresin Crown one day as a family. Thank you to all the staff for making our mini break such a happy memory for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great service with big smile!”
Reviews.Author: kojiStockholm_Sweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eresin Crown Hotel for six days in February. Great location very near historical sights. Many good restaurants around the hotel. The most impressive thing about the Eresin Crown was its personnel - very helpful, good service and big smile on every one of them. They made our stay in Istanbul so comfortable. Thanks you all at Eresin Crown!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: DanaHodorog
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed at! I especially like its location, near Blue Mosque, in the historical center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, situated near to the Blue Mosque and St Sofia”
Reviews.Author: Laura8949
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned from this hotel following a work trip to Istanbul. It is situated in a brilliant location, with beautiful views of the blue mosque dependant on where your room is located. The rooms themselves are very spacious, clean and have tea/coffee making facilities. All of the staff provide excellent service, and my suitcase was even taken to my room for me. There is a main restuarant downstairs where excellent food is served, and there is also a roof terrace perfect for summer - where you can see spectacular views of the sea. The location of which the hotel is in has a market, and is only a short distance away from The Blue Mosque and St Sofia Hagia museum which are both worth visiting during your trip. This provides an excellent base to see all of the main sights that Istanbul has to offer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will definately be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamNI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we were expecting-.comfortable and very central. The staff were charming, courteous, friendly and helpful, especially Murat on the Reception desk. The breakfast was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most charming hotel I've ev er seen”
Reviews.Author: hvhzsnt
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul with my wife for our 31Â° anniversary. We were looking for a charming hotel and we have found an outstanding one. Eresin Crown is not only a hotel, it is a jewel with historical art pieces from Roman and Byzantine time (mainly 5Â° and 6Â° AD centuries). The rooms are wonderful and service is excellent. Its position is perfect, in Sultanahmet very close to the Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The sight from the Terrace Restaurant is merely astonishing. Absolutely a top hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but could have a better location”
Reviews.Author: Dado_de_Castro
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a great hotel. The restaurant/breakfast is at the terrace, with a great view of the Bosforus and the Blue Mosque, but it is a cople hundred meters behind it, without a nicelly paved sidewalk. The staff was very helpfull and I canÂ´t understand some of the critics seen here.

Reviews.Title: “really suprised at inefficient staff”
Reviews.Author: suzanneitaly
Reviews.Content: We were very suprised at the sloppy service at this hotel. We waited more than 30 minutes for out luggage to be delivered to our room after checking in. The room overlooked the street and was quite noisey. Although the room was for two people there were never two bathrobes in the bathroom. However the real suprise was at breakfast. This is served on a terrace with an outstanding view. Pity that the service was so bad. We were there for 5 days; for the last three there were no napkins, no matter how many times you asked. The buffet had pigeons perched on the fruit bowls eating grapes and wasps drowning in the apricot compote. There were plenty of staff around, its just that they were totally inept. Do not use the hotel car to go to the airport, it is more than double the price of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay At the Eresin Crown Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: willy71YorkshireUk
Reviews.Content: An excellent mid size hotel, very comfortable, good rooms, spacious lounges, friendly and efficient staff, magnificent terrace restaurant atop hotel with panoramic views across the Bosphorus, the sea of Marmara and unique view of the Istanbul's Blue mosque. A very enjoyable stay in early October 2009 - V Matthews, Yorkshire UK.

Reviews.Title: “Error with booking the Eresin!”
Reviews.Author: Judgys
Reviews.Content: The error was ours in that I should have booked my original choice of the four seasons! We got to the hotel and were taken to a small room which could not even house my cse laid flat anywhere. The room stank of cigarettes despite requesting a non smoking room. I went to reception and after a lot of haggling as they originally offered to upgarde us at a cost to me of Â£100 per night they finally advised that they would upgrade us to a suite, free of charge. This was our wedding anniversary trip so I was not too happy that it took over an hour and a half to get moved and had to negotiate with the hotel manager. Upon getting to our suite we found it was a great size but the hotel is in need of renovation. The suite had a lounge area and dining area and complimentary fruit and a bottle of wine was provided. The hotel has no leisure facilities but if you go onto the top of the roof there is the most amazing view of the blue mosque. The staff at the hotel were brilliant and extremely helpful. The location is very central. Breakfast was simple but overall good. I would not stay at the Eresin again as I like my luxuries but overall if you get a god deal it would be worth your while to check it out. The staff made it really and were very helpful and being around the corner from the blue mosque is incredible. The beds were not good and very hard but you can't always have it all! The hotel also has a museum within it so you can grab some history at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “People wiiling to help”
Reviews.Author: privizzi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strategically located near to the back of the Blue Mosque and in front of the Bosforo. The dining terrace is really nice. The room are just a little bit small but comfortable and very clean. But the real difference is in the people. My wife got her wallet stolen in a Starbuck coffee and we had a person from the hotel dedicated to us to sort out all bureacracy work with the local police that was not so fluent with the English language. Beyond that episode all the people in the hotel were nice and willing to help. The positive feeling we brought back to home from this trip to Istanbul it's also due to the Eresin hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Eresin served us far better than the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Guidess
Reviews.Content: Well before i was little confused abt staying in Eresin as i had read some negative comments abt Eresin but the hotel itself proved the negative comments to be wrong.Its really far better than what i had read abt it.The rooms are nice(not small).The room cleaning is not done by any poor lady as written by some fellow here.There is a whole staff to serve you as you may have experienced in any other nice and decent five star hotel.I enjoyed my stay there and i really got a home like feeling there.Do stay there if you get to visit Istanbul.The attractions of istanbul old city are just a walk away and thats a plus and Yes there was no communication problem : )

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jjsbjd
Reviews.Content: In a great location but that is where the great or good ends. Room initially given on the ground floor level was small, dark with the window looking out to a narrow dark side laneway. Housekeeping substandard - Pillow cases had not been changed, hair from previous guest on the cases. To change rooms to a "superior room " that was still small but had light and faced the front, there was a charge of an extra E50 per day. Own Notebook - Internet wireless connection is charged E5 each straight hour. You can have no confidence in using the concierge service. The tour operator recommended by the Front Desk Manager, was his relative and overcharged a significant amount, in our case at least 40 - 50 %. We would suggest checking out all other Hotels in the area, and only use Eresin Crown as a last resort. Would we recommend this hotel to others ? Never!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnBAustralia
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I spent our last 3 nights in Istanbul at this Hotel. We enjoyed our stay. Our Room though small was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Restuarant and Bar facilities were very good. Hotel has historical artefacts which are very interesting. Hotel is in a good location and is walking distance from Istanbul's main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: LaPaj
Reviews.Content: A few min from Blue Mosque, hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, the staff, particularly Cetin Koca (front office mgr) is very resourceful and helpful. Hotel contains ancient artifacts found during its construction.

Reviews.Title: “the place to be in, In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: aksuozlem
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located â€“ we walked to everything â€“ the bazaar, the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the cutest streets â€“ safe to go walking at nights. The street of the hotel is well lit and quiet. The terrace was closed due to weather conditions but they were nice enough to allow us to go up there and take in the fabulous view. The staff speak English well. The hotel is well kept and the management are very cautious of people coming in from outside â€“ I assume there are high profile people staying at this hotel from time to time?? I recommend the cocktails at the hotels bar â€“ theres a nice menu of cocktails and we got to try the sultanahmet platter â€“ delicious! Ideal hotel for honeymoon - the noise factor is low and service standards â€“ excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexander67
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a special catagory Historical property. It is built on the site of an old palace and has been allowed to incorporate pieces of architecture from the original sight .It even has some original mosaic floor(under glass). The rooms are very comfortable,the restaurant and food is very good,the service excellent and the view from the rooftop restaurant and bar is outstanding. The Blue Mosque in one direction and the Bosphorus in the other. It is very central for most of the historical sights as it sighted in the Sultanahmet district of the old city. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who want luxury and convenience at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel claimed I cancelled my booking!”
Reviews.Author: zh260308
Reviews.Content: On 7 December 2007, I booked a promotional rate, 4 night stay in a Deluxe room at the five star rated Eresin Crown Hotel in Sultanahmet. On 16 March 2008 I received a confirmation from the Erisin Hotel website stating " We look forward to serving you during your upcoming stay at the Eresin Crown Hotel. If we can be of further assistance, please do not hesitate to reply to this e-mail or contact us". I read the email and then closed the email, everything appeared normal. My wife and I arrived at the hotel on Good Friday 21 March at 18.00pm and showed the gentleman at reception our booking confimation. The gentleman called the Hotel Division Manager and she said "Sorry you have cancelled your reservation in our reservation system and we are now fully booked". After fifteen minutes she offered us only one night stay in a Suite and the hotel would pay for a taxi to transfer us to their sister hotel "The Taxsim Premier Hotel" and they offered us a suite for three nights. I checked the web and all the other hotels in Sultanahmet were full so we had no choice but to accept the offer to be transferred to Taxsim. The hotel manager could not produce an email sent from me to prove I had cancelled the reservation. She did, however produced a copy of the cancellation sent to my email, dated 21 March at 17.35pm. i.e. 25 mins before we arrived at the hotel! Why on earth would I cancel my booking and then fly to Istanbul to check-in to the hotel. My advise to other travellers is to contact hotels in advance and confirm your bookings, even if you have a web confirmation. I did not cancel my booking and I was deeply appalled that the hotel sent a letter to our Suite which said "In reference to the cancellation situation discussed with you earlier - we regret to advise that the reservation was in fact cancelled at your end. I have attached a copy of the email sent from our system to you in response to the cancellation.....Kind Regards, Hotel Division Manager". The Suite at the Eresin was located at the front of the hotel and we could hear everything, including traffic, loud music and people talking in other rooms. Overall this is not the service I expect from a hotel with a five star rating. The sister hotel was only rated four stars and was located 20 minutes from the historic old town where we had looked forward to staying. I can only assume that when the hotel reservation system indicated to the hotel management that the hotel was fully booked they started sending out automatic cancellations to customers due to check-in later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: _kbb_Cork
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotelwas welcoming and had a lovely feel to it.The hotel has some ruins from the Byzantine period in its atrium.The staff were very pleasant and helpful.We stayed for one night in March.The location was great. Our room was lovely but too warm.We tried to turn on the AC..nothing.When we enquired about this at reception,we were told that the system had not been turned on in the hotel. Nothing could be done about this.As a result of this I got little sleep and had to open the window and was kept awake by the outside noise.I was disappointed with this. The breakfast was fantastic .

HotelInfo.Name: Eresin Crown Hotel - Sultanahmet
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya Cad. No:40 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
